intro: Sobralia stefaniae, commonly known as the Stefania's Sobralia, is a member of the Orchidaceae family, native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of fragrant, showy flowers. The flowers typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange, with intricate patterns resembling those of other orchids. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This plant is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in tropical gardens.
